references.reason: This paper introduced denoising diffusion probabilistic models (DDPMs), a foundational work in diffusion models that has significantly influenced subsequent research in the field.

references.paper_title: Diffusion models beat GANs on image synthesis
references.reason: This paper demonstrated that diffusion models can generate high-quality images that are competitive with state-of-the-art generative adversarial networks (GANs), which was a major milestone in the field.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduced latent diffusion models, a more scalable and efficient approach to training diffusion models that enables generation of higher-resolution images.

references.paper_title: Scaling rectified flow transformers for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper introduced a new architecture, mmDiT, that improved state-of-the-art performance on class-conditional image generation on ImageNet, which is directly relevant to this paper's contributions.

references.paper_title: SDXL: Improving latent diffusion models for high-resolution image synthesis
references.reason: This paper presents SDXL, a significant advancement in latent diffusion models that achieved state-of-the-art results at the time, providing a strong baseline for comparison in this research.
